an5.28:2.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dakkho nhāpako vā nhāpakantevāsī vā kaṁsathāle nhānīyacuṇṇāni ākiritvā udakena paripphosakaṁ paripphosakaṁ sanneyya. Sāyaṁ nhānīyapiṇḍi snehānugatā snehaparetā santarabāhirā phuṭā snehena, na ca paggharinī.
an5.28:2.4.en: It’s like when a deft bathroom attendant or their apprentice pours bath powder into a bronze dish, sprinkling it little by little with water. They knead it until [38;5;121mthe ball of bath powder[0m is soaked and saturated with moisture, spread through inside and out; yet no moisture oozes out.

They knead it until [38;5;121mthe ball of bath powder[0m is soaked and saturated with moisture, spread through inside and out; yet no moisture oozes out.

They knead it until [38;5;121mthe ball of bath powder[0m is soaked and saturated with moisture, spread through inside and out; yet no moisture oozes out.
